A Constant Flow of Gifts.--The money that God has entrusted to men is to be used in blessing humanity, in relieving the necessities of the suffering and the needy. Men are not to feel that they have done a very wonderful thing when they have endowed certain institutions or churches with large gifts. In the wise providence of God there are constantly presented before them the very ones who need their help. They are to relieve the suffering, clothe the naked, and help 
                                                                           269
many who are in hard and trying circumstances, who are wrestling with all their energies to keep themselves and their families from a pauper's home.-- Review and Herald, Jan. 4, 1898.
